original: @1b # // mu stegs byed kyi log par rtog pas the tshom skyed pa dag / yang sems can dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'dri bar byed de /
analyzed: @1b # // mu stegs byed kyi log par rtog pas the tshom skyed pa dag / yang sems can dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'dri bar byed de /
translated: The tirthikas, who are confused by false views, ask:

original: de la sems can sna tshogs pa ni khams dang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: de la sems can sna tshogs pa ni khams dang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Why is it that the various sentient beings, i.e., those of the different realms, destinies, modes of birth, etc.,

original: snod sna tshogs pa ni ri rab dang / gling la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //üîΩ'dren mar byed pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: snod sna tshogs pa ni ri rab dang / gling la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so // 'dren mar byed pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba byed pa rnams so //
translated: and the various physical worlds, i.e., those of the different Merus, continents, etc.,üîΩare not all born at the same time, since they are all the effect of action?

original: yang ci'i phyir de dag gi lus ni dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de dag gi lus ni dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa ma yin la /
translated: Why is it that the bodies of some are not delightful,

original: longs spyod rnams ni dga' ltar 'dug ce na /
analyzed: longs spyod rnams ni dga' ltar 'dug ce na /
translated: while the enjoyments of others are delightful?

original: de ltar na yul la nye bar longs spyod pa /
analyzed: de ltar na yul la nye bar longs spyod pa /
translated: Thus, the enjoyment of objects is possible.

original: srid de lus dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig gnyen por yul la nye bar spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid de lus dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir 'ga' zhig gnyen por yul la nye bar spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to make the body delightful, some enjoy objects as an antidote.

original: 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gzugs la spyod pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are not leading to liberation are those that are practiced by those who are in the form realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag kyang 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dag kyang 'dren mar byed pa ma yin pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The gods who are in the desire realm are similar to those who are not leading to liberation.

original: lus dang yul dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang yul dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa ste /
translated: The body and objects are as if delightful.

original: dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa nyid kyi rgyu las gnyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' dga' ltar 'dug pa nyid kyi rgyu las gnyis byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two actions are done for the cause of being as if delightful.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig tu bya'o @2a # //
analyzed: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ni 'di lta bu zhig tu bya'o @2a # //
translated: The intention is thinking, ‚ÄúThis should be done in this way.‚Äù

original: snyam du'o // gal te ngo bo nyid las yin na ni ngag gi las gcig pur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ngag nyid las yin pas na ngag gi las so zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyam du'o // gal te ngo bo nyid las yin na ni ngag gi las gcig pur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ngag nyid las yin pas na ngag gi las so zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were by nature, then it would be only verbal action, because it is action of speech since it is just speech.

original: gzhan gnyis las nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gnyis las nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not by the other two,

original: lus kyi las sam lus kyi las yin pas na /
analyzed: lus kyi las sam lus kyi las yin pas na /
translated: because it is bodily action or action of the body.

original: lus kyi las te yid kyi las kyang de dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: lus kyi las te yid kyi las kyang de dang 'dra bas /
translated: Mental action is also like that.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni las ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni las ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not action by nature.

original: rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rten dang ngo bo nyid dang kun nas slong bas so //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rten dang ngo bo nyid dang kun nas slong bas so //
translated: The three causes are the basis, the intrinsic nature, and the instigation.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three are

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las rnams so //
translated: the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: rten las ni lus kyi las te /
analyzed: rten las ni lus kyi las te /
translated: The action of body is based on the body.

original: lus la rten pa'i las ni lus kyi las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus la rten pa'i las ni lus kyi las zhes bya'o //
translated: The action of the body is called the action of body because it is the action that is based on the body.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi las ni ngag gi las te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi las ni ngag gi las te /
translated: The action of speech is by nature speech.

original: ngag nyid ngag gi las zhes bya'o //üîΩkun nas slong ba las ni yid kyi las te /
analyzed: ngag nyid ngag gi las zhes bya'o // kun nas slong ba las ni yid kyi las te /
translated: Speech itself is called the action of speech.üîΩThe action of mind is instigated by the mind.

original: yid kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the action of mind because it is instigated by the mind.

original: gzhan dag na re 'gro ba yin te zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag go //üîΩbdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'gro ba yin te zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa dag go // bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others say that it is going.üîΩThe VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas say that it is the self that is momentary, because it perishes immediately after it comes into existence.

original: skad cig ma de ma thag tu 'jig pa ni skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: skad cig ma de ma thag tu 'jig pa ni skad cig ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na bdag nyid du red ma thag tu 'jig pa ni skad cig ma zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúmoment‚Äù is derived from the root ‚àömas, to perish, in the sense of perishing immediately after coming into existence.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na skad cig ma ni dus kyi mtha' yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na skad cig ma ni dus kyi mtha' yin te /
translated: In one sense, a moment is the limit of time.

original: rang gi gnas skabs na 'dug pa de 'di la yod @2b pas na skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas skabs na 'dug pa de 'di la yod @2b pas na skad cig pa'o //
translated: That which exists in its own state is momentary.

original: 'dus byas ni gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni gdon mi za bar 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Because conditioned phenomena necessarily disintegrate, they are by nature momentary.

original: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are conditioned,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: like minds and mental factors.üîΩThe disintegration of things occurs without a cause.

original: dngos po rnams 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las 'byung bas na rgyu med pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pa las 'byung bas na rgyu med pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Because it arises without a cause, it arises without a cause.

original: rgyu med pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'di la bsgrub pa ni 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa can yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di la bsgrub pa ni 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa can yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúwithout a cause‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout a cause for disintegration.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The proof of this is as follows: Disintegration occurs without a cause because it is the mere absence of an entity.

original: gtan med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtan med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a complete nonentity.

original: shing la sogs pa dag med dang 'brel pa las 'jig pa'ang mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa dag med dang 'brel pa las 'jig pa'ang mthong zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction is seen in dependence on the nonexistence of such things as wood‚Äù and so on. The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes such things as form.

original: me dang 'brel pa las 'jig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: me dang 'brel pa las 'jig ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction in dependence on fire‚Äù

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo las bzlog pa mngon sum gyi sgo nas 'ongs so zhes dam bcas pa'i skyon ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo las bzlog pa mngon sum gyi sgo nas 'ongs so zhes dam bcas pa'i skyon ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: demonstrates the error of the assertion that the opposite of the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon is established by perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: mthong ba las brling ba'i tshad ma yang med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba las brling ba'i tshad ma yang med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThere is no other means of valid cognition that is stronger than perception.‚Äù

original: mngon sum pas brling ba'i tshad ma ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum pas brling ba'i tshad ma ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no means of valid cognition that is stronger than perception.

original: slob dpon gyis pha rol po dag mngon sum yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par bstan pa'i phyir re zhig khyod ces bya ba nas ji lta bur sems zhes bya ba'i bar smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis pha rol po dag mngon sum yin par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed par bstan pa'i phyir re zhig khyod ces bya ba nas ji lta bur sems zhes bya ba'i bar smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the opponent is conceited about perception, the master says, ‚ÄúFirst of all, you‚Äù up to ‚Äúhow do you think?‚Äù

original: shing la sogs pa 'jig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa 'jig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du mngon sum du mi dmigs so //
translated: The destruction of a tree, etc. is not perceived by the eye, etc. in the same way that form, etc. is.

original: skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba rnams kyis de dag yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba rnams kyis de dag yang mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The non-momentariness of things is the reason.

original: shing la sogs pa de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa de dag mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The destruction of a tree, etc. is not perceived because it is not present.

original: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub par ston par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas grub par ston par byed de /
translated: Thus, he shows that the destruction of a tree, etc. is established by inference.

original: shing la sogs pa 'jig pa ni me dang 'brel pa'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa 'jig pa ni me dang 'brel pa'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: The destruction of a tree, etc. is caused by the contact of fire,

original: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it occurs when that exists.

original: gang zhig gang yod na 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: Whatever occurs when something exists is caused by that,

original: dper na sa bon yod na 'byung ba'i myu gu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon yod na 'byung ba'i myu gu lta bu'o //
translated: like a sprout, for example, which occurs when a seed exists.

original: re zhig 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid rjod par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid rjod par byed do //
translated: This is to be investigated, he says, in order to express the uncertainty.

original: gang zhig yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yod na 'jig pa 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: Whatever occurs when something exists is not caused by that,

original: rlung dang 'brel pa yod na mar me 'jig mod kyi /
analyzed: rlung dang 'brel pa yod na mar me 'jig mod kyi /
translated: because a lamp is destroyed when wind exists,üîΩbut it is not caused by the wind.

original: 'jig pa de ni rlung dang 'brel pas byas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa de ni rlung dang 'brel pas byas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And that destruction is not caused by contact with wind.

original: mar me ni skad cig nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mar me ni skad cig nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a lamp is accepted as momentary,

original: 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du 'dod pa yin pas mar me de ni skyes nas 'jig pa'i phyir rang zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med pa can du 'dod pa yin pas mar me de ni skyes nas 'jig pa'i phyir rang zhig pa yin la /
translated: it is asserted that its destruction is causeless. Therefore, since a lamp is destroyed by itself after arising,

original: rlung dang 'brel ba'i phyir gzhan ma skyes na mi snang ba yin gyi /üîΩdes bshig pa'i phyir @3a * //
analyzed: rlung dang 'brel ba'i phyir gzhan ma skyes na mi snang ba yin gyi / des bshig pa'i phyir @3a * //
translated: if another lamp does not arise due to contact with wind, it does not appear.

original: ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not destroyed by that.

original: de bzhin du dril bu'i sgra skad cig mar 'dod pa yang lag pa dang 'brel pa yod na dril bu'i sgra 'jig mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du dril bu'i sgra skad cig mar 'dod pa yang lag pa dang 'brel pa yod na dril bu'i sgra 'jig mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, the sound of a bell is asserted to be momentary. If it exists in contact with the hand, the sound of the bell is destroyed.

original: de ni des byas pa ma yin gyi /üîΩskad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dril bu'i sgra ni rang zhig la des gegs byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni des byas pa ma yin gyi / skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dril bu'i sgra ni rang zhig la des gegs byas pa'i phyir /
translated: But that is not caused by that.

original: gzhan ma skyes na mi snang ba yin gyi des bshig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma skyes na mi snang ba yin gyi des bshig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is momentary, the sound of the bell is destroyed by itself, and if another sound does not arise due to an obstruction by that, it does not appear.üîΩBut it is not destroyed by that.

original: de lta bas na don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore this meaning is to be established by inference.

original: mngon sum du ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: I think that it is not established by direct perception.

original: de lta bas na gang zhig yod na 'ga' zhig 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig yod na 'ga' zhig 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya ba de ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that whatever exists is destroyed by that by which it is made.

original: 'di la rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di la rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩre zhig med pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa can yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di la rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba yin no // re zhig med pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa can yin te /
translated: What is the inference here? What is the inference in regard to the meaning of this statement, ‚ÄúDestruction is without cause‚Äù?üîΩIt has already been explained that what does not exist is not an action.

original: bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Destruction is without cause, because it is not an action, like space.

original: 'di yang bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not an action,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan med pa bzhin no //
translated: because it has the nature of a non-entity, like absolute non-existence.

original: 'ga' zhig rgyu med pa las mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rgyu med pa las mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang rgyu med pa las 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Some say: Nothing arises without a cause.

original: skye ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni zlog pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: skye ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni zlog pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: The example of reversal is like arising.

original: ji ltar skye ba ste bdag nyid du red pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu dang bcas pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba ste bdag nyid du red pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu dang bcas pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Just as arising, which has the characteristic of becoming self-established, definitely has a cause,

original: rgyu med pa can ni ma yin pa ltar 'jig pa yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa can ni ma yin pa ltar 'jig pa yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: so too destruction would be like that, but it is not.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skad cig ma blo dang / sgra dang / me lce dag 'jig pa rgyu med pa las byung ba yang mthong zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skad cig ma blo dang / sgra dang / me lce dag 'jig pa rgyu med pa las byung ba yang mthong zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said: The destruction of momentary minds, sounds and flames is seen to occur without a cause.

original: de ltar na chos kyi rang gi ngo bo las zlog pa rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi rang gi ngo bo las zlog pa rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the reversal of the intrinsic nature of phenomena is established by inference.

original: shing la sogs pa 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa 'jig pa ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: The destruction of wood and so on occurs without a cause

original: 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has the nature of destruction.

original: blo la sogs pa 'jig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa 'jig pa bzhin no //
translated: like the destruction of the mind, etc.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bye brag pa'o //üîΩblo sngar byung ba ni blo phyis 'byung bas 'jig la /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni bye brag pa'o // blo sngar byung ba ni blo phyis 'byung bas 'jig la /
translated: ‚ÄúSomeone‚Äù refers to the Vai≈õe·π£ika.üîΩThe prior mind is destroyed by the subsequent mind,

original: blo cig shos ni blo sngar byung bas 'jig ste /
analyzed: blo cig shos ni blo sngar byung bas 'jig ste /
translated: and the subsequent mind is destroyed by the prior mind.

original: sgra yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sound should be explained in the same way.

original: smras pa / de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Objection: That is not logical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blo gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cig car 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo gnyis phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni cig car 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because two minds do not make contact. This means that they do not occur simultaneously.

original: gzhig par bya ba med pa ni rgyus 'jig par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhig par bya ba med pa ni rgyus 'jig par mi byed do //
translated: That which is not destroyed is not caused to be destroyed by a cause.

original: blo dag @3b phrad pa med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: blo dag @3b phrad pa med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that the two minds do not make contact?

original: de'i phyir the tshom can dang / nges pa'i shes pa dag phrad par ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom can dang / nges pa'i shes pa dag phrad par ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore he says in detail, ‚ÄúIt is illogical for a doubting consciousness and a decisive consciousness to make contact.

original: gang gi tshe the tshom can gyi shes pa yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe the tshom can gyi shes pa yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When a doubting consciousness exists,

original: nges pa'i shes pa med la /
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa med la /
translated: There is no definitive knowledge.üîΩüîΩ

original: gang gi tshe nges pa'i shes pa yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nges pa'i shes pa yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when there is a determinate cognition,üîΩthen there is no indeterminate cognition.

original: the tshom can gyi shes pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rang gi nyams la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom can gyi shes pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni rang gi nyams la yod pa yin no //
translated: This is a matter of personal experience.

original: de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phrad pa med pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag phrad pa med pa yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, pleasure and pain, attachment and hatred, etc., are not in contact.

original: ji ltar 'gal ba dag mi phrad pa de bzhin du shes pa mi 'gal ba dag kyang phrad pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba dag mi phrad pa de bzhin du shes pa mi 'gal ba dag kyang phrad pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Just as incompatible things are not in contact, so too, non-incompatible cognitions are not in contact.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ste phrad par 'gyur du zin kyang 'on kyang blo dang sgra mi gsal ba dag gis gsal ba dag 'jig par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ste phrad par 'gyur du zin kyang 'on kyang blo dang sgra mi gsal ba dag gis gsal ba dag 'jig par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they were to come in contact, even then, a clear cognition would not be destroyed by a weak, unclear cognition,

original: nyam chung ba rigs mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyam chung ba rigs mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of the same type.

original: nyam chung pa rigs mthun pas stobs dang ldan pas 'jig pa ni ma mthong gi mi mthun pa ni /
analyzed: nyam chung pa rigs mthun pas stobs dang ldan pas 'jig pa ni ma mthong gi mi mthun pa ni /
translated: We never see a strong thing destroyed by a weak thing of the same type.

original: nyam chung ngus kyang 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyam chung ngus kyang 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: Even a weak thing is destroyed,

original: dper na chus me lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chus me lta bu'o //
translated: like fire by water.

original: gang yang gnas pa'i rgyu med pa 'am zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni gnas brtan dbyig bshes la sogs pas gnas pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams 'jig pa yin no zhes smras pa yin na //
analyzed: gang yang gnas pa'i rgyu med pa 'am zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni gnas brtan dbyig bshes la sogs pas gnas pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po rnams 'jig pa yin no zhes smras pa yin na //
translated: The argument that the elder Vasubandhu and others use, ‚ÄúThings are destroyed because there is no cause for their enduring,‚Äù

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: is not correct.

original: med pa ni rgyu yin par 'os pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: med pa ni rgyu yin par 'os pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Because it is not possible for a non-existent thing to be a cause.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis zhes zer ba ni bye brag pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dbang gis zhes zer ba ni bye brag pa'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that things are destroyed by the power of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de la skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin ba dag kyang skad cig skad cig nyid la 'jug pa thob pa dang / gegs byed par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang chos ma yin ba dag kyang skad cig skad cig nyid la 'jug pa thob pa dang / gegs byed par 'os pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They say that the causes of origination and destruction, virtue and nonvirtue, are not suitable to be active and obstructive at every moment.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyu chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: The causes of origination and destruction are virtue and nonvirtue.

original: skad cig skad cig nyid la zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dngos la ste /
analyzed: skad cig skad cig nyid la zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dngos la ste /
translated: In each instant means in the actual moment,

original: nye bar btags pa'i skad cig ma la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i skad cig ma la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not in a moment that is a conceptual fiction.

original: yang na skad cig skad cig nyid la zhes bya ba ni skad cig skad cig kho na la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na skad cig skad cig nyid la zhes bya ba ni skad cig skad cig kho na la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, in each instant means in each moment alone.

original: 'jug pa thob pa dang / gegs byed pa ni 'jug pa thob pa dang / 'jug pa la gegs byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa thob pa dang / gegs byed pa ni 'jug pa thob pa dang / 'jug pa la gegs byed pa ste /
translated: The obtaining of the operation and the obstruction of the operation are the obtaining of the operation and the obstruction of the operation.

original: skad cig skad cig la 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la 'gyur bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable that they change in each instant.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: me lce gang zhig byung na nag pa 'am /
analyzed: me lce gang zhig byung na nag pa 'am /
translated: The flame that arises either removes darkness or benefits the flame.

original: byams pa la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba de'i chos 'jug pa rnyed pa ni bde ba skyed par byed pas de ltar na bskyed pa'i rgyu yang @4a * //
analyzed: byams pa la phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba de'i chos 'jug pa rnyed pa ni bde ba skyed par byed pas de ltar na bskyed pa'i rgyu yang @4a * //
translated: The obtaining of the operation of that is the cause of generation, because it generates pleasure.

original: yin no // gal te de zhig pas mun pa'i gnas skabs na de la phan 'dogs par byed na 'jig pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
analyzed: yin no // gal te de zhig pas mun pa'i gnas skabs na de la phan 'dogs par byed na 'jig pa'i rgyu yang yin no //
translated: If it benefits the flame when darkness is present, because it is destroyed, it is also the cause of destruction.

original: de bzhin du chos ma yin pa yang me lce gang zhig byung na 'ga' la gnod par 'gyur na de'i chos ma yin pa 'jug pa rnyed pa ni de skyed par byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos ma yin pa yang me lce gang zhig byung na 'ga' la gnod par 'gyur na de'i chos ma yin pa 'jug pa rnyed pa ni de skyed par byed la /
translated: So too, with respect to non-Dharma, if a flame arises, it would harm something, and the activity of that non-Dharma would be to generate it.

original: gal te des mun pa'i gnas skabs na de zhig pas gnod par byed na 'jig pa'i rgyu yang yin pas de gnyis kyi 'jug pa rnyed pa las me lce 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //üîΩde dag kho nas de dag gi 'jug pa 'gags te skad cig de nyid la de rnams 'jig par ni rigs pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te des mun pa'i gnas skabs na de zhig pas gnod par byed na 'jig pa'i rgyu yang yin pas de gnyis kyi 'jug pa rnyed pa las me lce 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe'o // de dag kho nas de dag gi 'jug pa 'gags te skad cig de nyid la de rnams 'jig par ni rigs pa ma yin pas /
translated: If it harms that which is destroyed in the state of darkness, then it would also be the cause of its destruction. Therefore, the flame would arise from the activity of both.üîΩIt is not logical that they are destroyed in that very moment when their activity is stopped by those two alone.

original: skad cig skad cig la gnyis po 'jug pa rnyed pa dang / gags byed pa ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig la gnyis po 'jug pa rnyed pa dang / gags byed pa ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the two are active and stopped moment by moment.

original: rgyu yongs su brtags pa 'di yang 'dus byas thams cad la bya bar nus zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pas 'jig go zhes rgyu yongs su brtag pa ni 'dus byas mi rtag pa rdul phran gnyis la sogs pa'i gzugs la
analyzed: rgyu yongs su brtags pa 'di yang 'dus byas thams cad la bya bar nus zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pas 'jig go zhes rgyu yongs su brtag pa ni 'dus byas mi rtag pa rdul phran gnyis la sogs pa'i gzugs la
translated: The investigation of causes, ‚ÄúThings are destroyed by virtue and nonvirtue,‚Äù applies to impermanent conditioned states, such as form composed of two or more atoms,

original: sogs pa dang las thams cad la yang bya bar nus pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: sogs pa dang las thams cad la yang bya bar nus pas de'i phyir /
translated: and to all actions.

original: me dang 'brel ba las shing la sogs pa 'jig go zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'di brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: me dang 'brel ba las shing la sogs pa 'jig go zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'di brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that things such as wood are destroyed in dependence on fire.

original: de'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni de rnams 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma nyid du grub pas brtsad mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni de rnams 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma nyid du grub pas brtsad mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, since virtue and nonvirtue do not depend on other causes for the destruction of conditioned states, it is established that all conditioned states are momentary.

original: de nyid dam de dang 'dra ba las zhes bya ba ni gal te me dang 'brel bas bum pa'i sngon po nyid bzlog nas dmar po nyid skyed par byed pa de kho nas dmar po nyid bzlog nas ches dmar ba skyed par byed do zhes bya bar rtog
analyzed: de nyid dam de dang 'dra ba las zhes bya ba ni gal te me dang 'brel bas bum pa'i sngon po nyid bzlog nas dmar po nyid skyed par byed pa de kho nas dmar po nyid bzlog nas ches dmar ba skyed par byed do zhes bya bar rtog
translated: That is, if you think that the fire‚Äôs relationship with the pot reverses its blueness and generates redness, then that very fire reverses redness and generates greater redness.

original: na rgyu nyid 'jig par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te me rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa skyed par byed pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: na rgyu nyid 'jig par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro // 'on te me rnams ni skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa skyed par byed pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: Then the cause itself would be the destroyer.

original: 'jig par byed pa yang gzhan yin no zhes bya bar rtog na /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yang gzhan yin no zhes bya bar rtog na /
translated: But if you think that because fires are momentary, the generator of the relationship with the fire is one thing and the destroyer of that relationship is another,üîΩthen the cause of generation would be undifferentiated.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu bye brag med par 'gyur te rigs pas ma yin no zhes bya ba thams cad brjod do //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rgyu bye brag med par 'gyur te rigs pas ma yin no zhes bya ba thams cad brjod do //
translated: We state that all of this is illogical.

original: re zhig me rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig me rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because fires are momentary,

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis me lce dag la skyed par byed pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis me lce dag la skyed par byed pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that the generator of the flames is one thing and the destroyer of the flames is another.

original: 'jig par byed pa yang gzhan yin no zhes rgyu tha dad par yongs su brtag par ni bya ba la dag na thal ba nas sa dang 'brel pa'i bar las smin byed las skyes pa'i bye brag byung ba la @4b gang la brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yang gzhan yin no zhes rgyu tha dad par yongs su brtag par ni bya ba la dag na thal ba nas sa dang 'brel pa'i bar las smin byed las skyes pa'i bye brag byung ba la @4b gang la brtag par bya ste /
translated: But if you imagine that the cause is different, then from the time of the threshing floor up to the time of the connection with the ground, the seed would be destroyed by the agent of ripening, and what would be imagined?

original: de dag gi ltar na thal ba la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin pas der rgyu nyid 'jig par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na thal ba la sogs pa skad cig ma ma yin pas der rgyu nyid 'jig par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: According to them, the threshing floor, etc., are not momentary, so the cause would be destroyed there.

original: 'o na gang chu bskol ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'o na gang chu bskol ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But if you think that the water is boiled,

original: gal te me dang 'brel pa dag gis chu 'jig par mi byed na 'o na ji ltar chu bskol ba rnams zad par 'gyur snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te me dang 'brel pa dag gis chu 'jig par mi byed na 'o na ji ltar chu bskol ba rnams zad par 'gyur snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: if the connection with fire does not destroy the water, then how do the boiled waters perish?

original: me'i khams zhes bya ba ni de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: me'i khams zhes bya ba ni de dang tha mi dad par 'dug pa 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The fire element increases without being different from it.

original: de'i mthus na chu'i tshogs nyam chung zhing nyam chung par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur bas nyam chung ba dang ches nyam chung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i mthus na chu'i tshogs nyam chung zhing nyam chung par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i khyad par las 'bras bu'i khyad par du 'gyur bas nyam chung ba dang ches nyam chung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: that is, the result becomes weaker and weaker due to the specific cause.

original: shin tu nyam chung ba'i bar du gyur pa dang mjug tu rgyun yang rgyun chags par mi byed de 'bras bu mi skyed kyi dngos po med par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'jig pa'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shin tu nyam chung ba'i bar du gyur pa dang mjug tu rgyun yang rgyun chags par mi byed de 'bras bu mi skyed kyi dngos po med par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'jig pa'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It becomes extremely weak and finally it does not continuously generate a continuum, that is, it does not generate a result, but it does not become a nonexistent thing.üîΩBecause it has the character of disintegration,

original: rang 'jig pa ni gzhan gyis 'jig pa skyed pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: rang 'jig pa ni gzhan gyis 'jig pa skyed pa ma yin pas /
translated: because it has the character of disintegration, disintegration is not generated by another.

original: byung ba tsam ste skad cig ma gcig rang gi bdag nyid du red nas 'jig go //
analyzed: byung ba tsam ste skad cig ma gcig rang gi bdag nyid du red nas 'jig go //
translated: It is merely arisen, that is, it disintegrates after a single moment of its own existence.

original: rtsva'i me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rtsva'i me skad cig ma yin yang rtsva yul gzhan du bar chad med par byung ba la rtsva sreg par byed pa'i me 'gro'o zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rtsva'i me bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rtsva'i me skad cig ma yin yang rtsva yul gzhan du bar chad med par byung ba la rtsva sreg par byed pa'i me 'gro'o zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, although the fire of grass is momentary, it is as if it were to go to the grass that arises without interval in another place, since it burns the grass.

original: 'dir bsgrub pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul gzhan du bar chad med par 'byung ba'i dngos po dag ni 'gro ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul gzhan du bar chad med par 'byung ba'i dngos po dag ni 'gro ba med pa yin te /
translated: Here the proof is: things that arise without interval in another place, such as form, do not go,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rtsva'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rtsva'i me bzhin no //
translated: because they are momentary, like the fire of grass.

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dbyibs yin no zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed dbyibs yin no zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba yin no //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say that bodily informative form is shape.

original: phyogs gcig gi sgo zhes bya ba ni 'di la phyogs gcig gi sgo yod pas na phyogs gcig gi sgo ste der ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi sgo zhes bya ba ni 'di la phyogs gcig gi sgo yod pas na phyogs gcig gi sgo ste der ro //
translated: In one direction means in one part.

original: mang po ni phal mo che'o //
analyzed: mang po ni phal mo che'o //
translated: Many means most.

original: thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi sgo gyen du phal che ba la ni mthon po zhes 'dogs la /
analyzed: thams cad kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi sgo gyen du phal che ba la ni mthon po zhes 'dogs la /
translated: The direction that is mostly above is called high.

original: thur du phal che ba la ni dma' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thur du phal che ba la ni dma' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The direction that is mostly below is called low.

original: 'di ni phyogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs yin no //
translated: This is the direction.

original: dper na mgal me zhes bya ba ni dbyibs ni rdzas su med de de 'dzin pa kha dog 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mgal me zhes bya ba ni dbyibs ni rdzas su med de de 'dzin pa kha dog 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir na mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin no //
translated: For example, shape does not exist as a substance, because the apprehension of shape depends on the apprehension of color, like the circle of a firebrand.

original: yang na dbyibs ni rdzas su med de /
analyzed: yang na dbyibs ni rdzas su med de /
translated: Or, shape does not exist as a substance,

original: gzugs 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'bru'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa la ltos pa'i phyir 'bru'i phung po bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because the apprehension of form depends on the apprehension of a mass of grain.

original: 'di dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba ring po nyid la sogs pa @5a * //
analyzed: 'di dbang po gnyis kyis gzung bar 'gyur zhes bshad pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba ring po nyid la sogs pa @5a * //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: It is said that shape is apprehended by two sense faculties,

original: ni lus kyi dbang pos 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ni lus kyi dbang pos 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: but longness and so on are not apprehended by the body sense faculty.

original: 'o na ci zhe na reg bya'i yan lag dag kho na de ltar gnas pa la ring po la sogs par 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na reg bya'i yan lag dag kho na de ltar gnas pa la ring po la sogs par 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then long and so on are apprehended by the body sense faculty, because they are apprehended by the body sense faculty in dependence on the primary elements that are the basis of the body sense faculty.

original: de bas na 'di ni gnyis kyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang na ji ltar reg bya la zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni gnyis kyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes smra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang na ji ltar reg bya la zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par smos so //
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúOr, how is it that you apprehend a long tactile object?‚Äù

original: don ci zhe na /
analyzed: don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: ji ltar reg bya la ring po dang thung ngu la sogs pa 'dzin mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar reg bya la ring po dang thung ngu la sogs pa 'dzin mod kyi /
translated: Just as you apprehend a long or short tactile object,

original: dbyibs ni reg bya'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: dbyibs ni reg bya'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa yang ma yin pa ltar /
translated: but shape is not included in the base of tactility,

original: kha dog la ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang de dang 'dra bar yid ches par bya ste /
analyzed: kha dog la ring po la sogs pa 'dzin pa yang de dang 'dra bar yid ches par bya ste /
translated: you should understand that the apprehension of a long color and so on is similar.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i dbyibs don gzhan du gyur pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i dbyibs don gzhan du gyur pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that shape that is included in the form base is not a different object.

original: yang na bye brag tu smra bas de la ni reg bya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dran pa tsam yin gyi zhes bya bar rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: yang na bye brag tu smra bas de la ni reg bya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir dran pa tsam yin gyi zhes bya bar rgyas par smras te /
translated: Or, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says, ‚ÄúIt is mere memory because it is concomitant with tactility.‚Äù

original: dbyibs de la ni reg bya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir te 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'i reg bya dang lhan cig spyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir /üîΩdran pa tsam yin gyi ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs mngon sum du 'dzin pa ni ma yin te dper na lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir me'i gzugs mthong nas me de'i tsha ba'i dran pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir me tog tsam pa ka'i dri
analyzed: dbyibs de la ni reg bya dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir te 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'i reg bya dang lhan cig spyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir / dran pa tsam yin gyi ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs mngon sum du 'dzin pa ni ma yin te dper na lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir me'i gzugs mthong nas me de'i tsha ba'i dran pa 'byung ba dang lhan cig spyod pa'i phyir me tog tsam pa ka'i dri
translated: Because shape is concomitant with tactility, it is concomitant with the tactile objects of smoothness and so on.

original: bsnams nas de'i kha dog gi dran pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bsnams nas de'i kha dog gi dran pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is merely memory, it does not directly apprehend the shape of a long thing and so on, just as when one sees the form of fire, the memory of its heat arises because they are concomitant and when one smells the scent of a champak flower, the memory of its color arises because they are concomitant.

original: slob dpon gyis 'di la ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis gzhan dran par rigs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di la ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis gzhan dran par rigs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúBecause there is no error here, it is logical that one thing is remembered through another,‚Äù

original: me la sogs pa 'di la ni tsha ba nyid dang / kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis gzhan te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa 'di la ni tsha ba nyid dang / kha dog 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyis gzhan te /
translated: because there is no error in the heat and color of fire and so on.

original: me'i gzugs kyis tsha ba nyid dang me tog gi dris de'i kha dog dran par rigs so ;üîΩ/ reg bya ni cung zad kyang nges pa med do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang las reg bya la reg nas ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs 'di nges par dran par 'gyur pa 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'i reg bya ni chung zad kyang
analyzed: me'i gzugs kyis tsha ba nyid dang me tog gi dris de'i kha dog dran par rigs so ; / reg bya ni cung zad kyang nges pa med do zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang las reg bya la reg nas ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs 'di nges par dran par 'gyur pa 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa'i reg bya ni chung zad kyang
translated: It is reasonable to remember heat by the form of fire and the color of a flower by its smell.üîΩBut there is no certainty at all that smoothness and so on are tactile objects of long and so forth, because it is said that smoothness and so on are not tactile objects of long and so forth.

original: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs gang la yang nges pa med do //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs gang la yang nges pa med do //
translated: There is no certainty at all that smoothness and so on are tactile objects of long and so forth, because when one touches smoothness and so on, one remembers the shape of long and so forth.

original: gang na me'i gzugs yod pa de ni de'i tsha ba nyid yod la /
analyzed: gang na me'i gzugs yod pa de ni de'i tsha ba nyid yod la /
translated: Wherever the form of fire exists, heat exists there.

original: gang na me tog tsam pa ka'i dri yod pa de na'ang 'di'i gzugs yod kyi /
analyzed: gang na me tog tsam pa ka'i dri yod pa de na'ang 'di'i gzugs yod kyi /
translated: Wherever the smell of a champak flower exists, its form exists there.

original: gang na 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid yod pa de na ring ba nyid dang thung ba nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na 'jam pa nyid dang rtsub pa nyid yod pa de na ring ba nyid dang thung ba nyid yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But wherever smoothness and roughness exist, long and short do not exist there.

original: de lta bas na de'i tsha ba nyid dang / de'i gzugs dag ni gdon mi za bar dran par rung gi dbyibs ni gdon mi za bar dran @5b par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tsha ba nyid dang / de'i gzugs dag ni gdon mi za bar dran par rung gi dbyibs ni gdon mi za bar dran @5b par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the heat and the color of the fire are recalled, but the shape is not necessarily recalled.

original: 'on te reg bya dang dbyibs dag lhan cig spyod par nges pa med kyang nges par dbyibs dran par gyur na ni kha dog kyang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te reg bya dang dbyibs dag lhan cig spyod par nges pa med kyang nges par dbyibs dran par gyur na ni kha dog kyang 'gyur te /
translated: But if the shape is recalled even though the tactile contact and the shape are not necessarily experienced together, then the color also should be recalled.

original: nges par dran par zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: nges par dran par zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is certain that‚Äù should be supplied.

original: reg bya de kho na reg nas dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: reg bya de kho na reg nas dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The tactile contact is recalled just as it is, that is, without the shape.

original: ji ste yang nges par kha dog dran par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: ji ste yang nges par kha dog dran par mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if the color is not necessarily recalled,

original: yang na ni kha dog bzhin du dbyibs kyang nges par mi 'gyur te /üîΩring po la'ang thung ngur shes la /
analyzed: yang na ni kha dog bzhin du dbyibs kyang nges par mi 'gyur te / ring po la'ang thung ngur shes la /
translated: then the shape also should not be necessarily recalled, just like the color.üîΩFor one would know a long shape as short,

original: thung ngu la yang ring por shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung ngu la yang ring por shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and a short shape as long.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: reg bya las kha dog ni nges par dran par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg bya las kha dog ni nges par dran par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The color is not necessarily recalled from the tactile contact.

original: res 'ga' dmar po la yang ser por shes la /
analyzed: res 'ga' dmar po la yang ser por shes la /
translated: Sometimes one knows a red color as yellow,üîΩand a yellow color as red.

original: ser po la yang dmar por shes so //
analyzed: ser po la yang dmar por shes so //
translated: One would also know red as yellow.

original: de lta yang ma yin zhes bya ba ji ltar de ltar ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin zhes bya ba ji ltar de ltar ma yin zhe na /
translated: But that is not so.

original: ji ltar kha dog nges par dran par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dbyibs kyang nges par dran par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar kha dog nges par dran par mi 'gyur ba de ltar dbyibs kyang nges par dran par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as one does not remember the color as it really is, so also one does not remember the shape as it really is.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: kha dog nges par mi 'gyur gyi dbyibs ni nges par dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog nges par mi 'gyur gyi dbyibs ni nges par dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: One remembers the shape as it really is, but not the color.

original: de bas na reg bya las dbyibs 'di dran par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na reg bya las dbyibs 'di dran par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to remember shape from tactile awareness.

original: 'o na ji ltar ring po'i blo 'am thung ngu'i blo 'byung zhe na /üîΩ'di ni phyogs gcig gi sgor kha dog gam /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ring po'i blo 'am thung ngu'i blo 'byung zhe na / 'di ni phyogs gcig gi sgor kha dog gam /
translated: How then does the idea of long or short arise?üîΩThe idea of long arises from the idea of a multitude of colors or tactile objects in one place.

original: reg bya phal mo che 'dzin pa la ring po'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg bya phal mo che 'dzin pa la ring po'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'byung ngo //
translated: The idea of short arises from the idea of a small number of colors or tactile objects in one place.

original: zhes bshad zin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the case with all other shapes.

original: ri mo bkram pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ri mo bkra pa kha dog dang dbyibs du ma rnam pa mang por snang ba ni ring po la sogs par dbyibs gcig tu snang ste /
analyzed: ri mo bkram pa la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ri mo bkra pa kha dog dang dbyibs du ma rnam pa mang por snang ba ni ring po la sogs par dbyibs gcig tu snang ste /
translated: The extensive explanation of ‚Äúthe arrangement of a painting‚Äù is as follows: A painting with many colors and shapes appears in many aspects. Length and so on appear as a single shape.

original: de bas na kha dog dang dbyibs du ma snang ba'i phyir dbyibs mang po yang phyogs gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na kha dog dang dbyibs du ma snang ba'i phyir dbyibs mang po yang phyogs gcig tu 'gyur te /

analyzed: gang na ring po nyid yod pa de nyid du thung ngu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dbyibs de nyid ring po la sogs pa dang thung du la sogs pa'i blo ba skyed do zhes brjod par yang mi rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dag de ltar gnas pa la ni de'i ming 'thob par 'os pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar grog ma la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs gcig pa yin la /
translated: Ants and so on have the same color and shape.

original: de dag gi phreng ba ni yul la lar ni gzhan du snang la /
analyzed: de dag gi phreng ba ni yul la lar ni gzhan du snang la /

analyzed: la lar ni gzhan du snang ba dang / zlum pe la sogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de dang 'dra ste /

translated: Likewise, even though color is undifferentiated, shape would be differentiated.

analyzed: gal te dbyibs kha dog las rigs gzhan zhig yin par ma gyur na ji ltar sngon po 'am /

translated: one would not see blue, etc.üîΩIf shape were a different type from color, then just as one sees blue or yellow, one would not see long or short, etc.üîΩBut sometimes one sees long or short, etc.,üîΩand sometimes one sees blue, etc.

original: de'i phyir dbyibs ni rigs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs ni rigs gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore shape is a different type from color.

original: phreng ba dang dmag la yongs su rtog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phreng ba dang dmag la yongs su rtog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the conception of a garland and an army.

original: ji ltar mun khung na bya 'am grog ma mi gsal ba mthong nas phreng ring po zhig go zhes rtog par byed pa 'am ji ltar mun khung na glang po che la sogs pa mi gsal ba mthong nas dmag 'di ni bskyil te rnam par gnas so zhes
analyzed: ji ltar mun khung na bya 'am grog ma mi gsal ba mthong nas phreng ring po zhig go zhes rtog par byed pa 'am ji ltar mun khung na glang po che la sogs pa mi gsal ba mthong nas dmag 'di ni bskyil te rnam par gnas so zhes
translated: Just as when one sees a bird or an ant in the dark, one has the notion that it is a long line, or just as when one sees an elephant in the dark, one has the notion that the army is encircling it and standing there.üîΩThis is similar to that.

original: yongs su rtog par byed pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩde ni gdon mi za bar de ltar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni da gzod ji skad du dbyibs rigs gzhan med kyang /

translated: That is to be understood without doubt, as follows.üîΩThis is just as it was explained that although shape is not a different type of substance, one sees only color there in the dark, and one has the notion of long, etc.

original: de dag gis de na kha dog kho na mi gsal ba mthong bas ring po la sogs par yongs su rtog par byed do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag gis de na kha dog kho na mi gsal ba mthong bas ring po la sogs par yongs su rtog par byed do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: When one sees a part of the body, etc.,

analyzed: yang na 'phags pa de dag zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe gzugs de lta bu de bzhed pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyas par chos zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len par 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni sems kyi tha ba dang spags pa'i gzhi yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched zag pa med pa de dag ni yod do

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dang / phyi'i gzugs rnams te /

original: zag pa rnams kyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa rnams kyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par ro //

original: tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims ni mi dge bas kun nas slong ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po gzugs kyis pa'i tshul khrims rnam par rig byed maüîΩyin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims ni mi dge bas kun nas slong ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po gzugs kyis pa'i tshul khrims rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rung ngo //
translated: Immorality in the desire realm is motivated by nonvirtue, so it is reasonable to say that the antidote to that is the morality of the form realm, which is characterized by nonindicative form.

original: gal te gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the same would be true of the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs med pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams nas zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúThe formless realm is distant from the desire realm‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams dag ni 'dod pa'i khams nas ring ba nyid bzhis ring ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams dag ni 'dod pa'i khams nas ring ba nyid bzhis ring ba bzhin no //
translated: The formless realm is distant from the desire realm by four types of distance.

original: ring ba'i phyir gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: ring ba'i phyir gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yin par mi rung ste /
translated: Since the formless realm is distant, the morality subsumed by the formless realm is not a counteragent to the desire realm.

original: ring ba nyid bzhi ni gong du bshad zin pas yang mi bshad do //
analyzed: ring ba nyid bzhi ni gong du bshad zin pas yang mi bshad do //
translated: The four kinds of distance have already been explained above, so they will not be explained again here.

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni gnyen po ring ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni gnyen po ring ba nyid yin no //
translated: The example here is the distance of the counteragent.

original: rnam rig dpyod dang bcas pa dag na zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa kho na dag na yod do zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam rig dpyod dang bcas pa dag na zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa kho na dag na yod do zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir brtsams pa yin te /
translated: They exist in the realm of investigation and analysis means that they exist only in the stage of investigation and analysis.

original: brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra bas lus dang ngag gi las dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags shing dpyad nas tshig tu smra bas lus dang ngag gi las dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in order to ascertain that physical and verbal karma are preceded by investigation and analysis because one speaks words after investigating and analyzing.

original: 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med //
analyzed: 'dod pa na yang bsgribs pa med //
translated: Obscured neutral states do not exist in the desire realm.

original: ces bya ba ni dpyod pa med pa'i sa dag na med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dpyod pa med pa'i sa dag na med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: This shows that they do not exist in stages devoid of analysis alone.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten kho na na yod do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten kho na na yod do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: They exist only in the Brahma world.

original: de yan @17a * //
analyzed: de yan @17a * //
translated: Up to here

original: chad ces bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad do //
analyzed: chad ces bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad do //

original: phyi'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i sgra'i skye mched do //
analyzed: phyi'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba ni rlung la sogs pa'i sgra'i skye mched do //
translated: Sound that is derived from the great elements that are its cause means sound that is derived from the great elements of wind, etc.

original: 'di ni rnam par rig byed kyi sgra dgag pa lhur bya bar smos pa yin gyi phyi'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas pa kho na yod pa ni ma yin te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na ni lag pa la sogs pa'i sgra yang srid do
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rig byed kyi sgra dgag pa lhur bya bar smos pa yin gyi phyi'i 'byung ba chen po rgyur byas pa kho na yod pa ni ma yin te bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na ni lag pa la sogs pa'i sgra yang srid do
translated: This is said with the intention of refuting sound that is expression. It is not that sound that is derived from the great elements that are its cause does not exist, because in the second absorption and so on, sound of hands and so on is possible.

original: // de lta ma yin na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: // de lta ma yin na bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos las ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos las ni /

analyzed: gang zhig sgra'i khams dang ldan zhe na /

original: smras pa / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'o //

original: gang zhig mi ldan zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gang zhig mi ldan zhe na smras pa /

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o zhes bshad de /

original: thob dang ma thob rang rgyud du //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob rang rgyud du //

analyzed: gtogs pa rnams kyi zhes 'byung ba'i phyir sems can du mi bgrang ba'i phyi rol gyi dang ni ldan par rung ba ma yin no //

analyzed: nyes pa 'di nyid spang ba'i phyir gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa na yang rnam par rig byed yod do zhes bya ba yin no //

original: gang gis pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis pa zhig yin zhe na /

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i 'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i 'o //

analyzed: 'di ni bye brag smra ba kho na'i phyogs yin par zad kyi phyogs gzhan ni ma yin te /

original: grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: Because the Abhidharmako≈õa declares:

analyzed: gnyis pa sogs na lus mig dang // rna ba'i rnam shes rnam rig slong //
translated: In the second and so on, the body, eye, and ear consciousnessesüîΩand the indicative form that motivates them

original: gang yin de ni dang por gtogs //
analyzed: gang yin de ni dang por gtogs //
translated: belong to the first absorption.

original: de lung ma bstan nyon mongs min //üîΩzhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lung ma bstan nyon mongs min // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are neutral and not affliction.

original: phyogs gzhan de bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan de bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i sa pa yin no //
translated: The other position is that it belongs to the level of the second absorption and so on.

original: de yang ci lung du ma bstan pa zhig gam lung du bstan pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci lung du ma bstan pa zhig gam lung du bstan pa zhig ce na /
translated: Moreover, is it neutral or is it declared?

original: de'i phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par rig byed ni yod kyi dge ba'ang med la nyon mongs pa can yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par rig byed ni yod kyi dge ba'ang med la nyon mongs pa can yang med do zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir dge ba yang med la nyon mongs pa can yang med ce na /

analyzed: de dag tu skyes pa ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa ni sa 'og ma pa'i sems te sems gang gis dge ba'am nyon mongs pa can @17b gyi rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar 'gyur ba de lta bu ste /

original: dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can lta bu mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can lta bu mngon sum du mi byed do //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dman pa dang spangs zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i dge ba ni dman pa'i phyir dang spang ba'i phyir mngon du mi byed la /

original: nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pas shugs kyis na 'di skad du sa 'og ma pa'i sems lung du ma bstan pa gang gis na de kun nas slong bar byed pa ste mngon sum du byed de zhes bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du sa 'og ma pa'i rnam par rig byed ni sa 'og ma pa'i sems kyis slong bar byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni de de ltar mi 'dod de rnam par rig byed de bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa kho na yin no zhe'o //

translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas do not accept that, because that informative form is only of the first meditation stage, since it is motivated by the mind of the first meditation stage.

original: de lta bas na snga ma kho na brjod do zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩde yang 'dod pa'i khams na med do zhes bya ba ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de yang 'dod pa'i khams na med de 'dod pa'i khams na ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa 'jig tshogs dang /

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yod par 'dod la /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yod par 'dod la /
translated: And that is not in the desire realm. That obscured neutral mind that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation does not exist in the desire realm, because in the desire realm it is asserted that obscured neutral states are only concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: kha nang du bltas pa yin pa'i phyir des kyang rnam par rig byed ni kun nas slong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: kha nang du bltas pa yin pa'i phyir des kyang rnam par rig byed ni kun nas slong bar mi byed do //

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: By nature means by itself.

original: mchog tu bde pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba dang rjes su 'brel ba dag kyang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mchog tu bde pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba dang rjes su 'brel ba dag kyang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is supremely blissful means that it is not associated with suffering.

original: ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas slong bas dge ba gang yin pa de ni mchog tu bde ba yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas slong bas dge ba gang yin pa de ni mchog tu bde ba yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That which is virtuous by nature, concomitance, or motivation is supremely blissful.

translated: Because those not concomitant with them are not virtuous means that because minds, etc. that are not concomitant with roots of virtue, etc. are not virtuous, those concomitant with them

original: ni dge ba nyid yin par grub po //
analyzed: ni dge ba nyid yin par grub po //

analyzed: 'thungs pa'i ba las byung ba'i 'o ma gang yin pa de ni sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las byung ba'i 'o ma'o //
translated: The milk that arises from a cow who has drunk a medicinal drink is milk that arises from drinking a medicinal drink.üîΩObtaining virtue that is motivated by a mind of a different realm, etc.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i thob pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge ba'i thob pa skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba rnams so //

translated: Obtaining virtue that is motivated by a mind of a different realm is obtaining virtue that is motivated by a mind of a different realm.

analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sems ni dge ba las gzhan pa yin te /
translated: A mind of a different realm is any mind other than virtuous.

translated: When one who is doubtful reconnects with the root of virtue, the obtaining of virtue is not virtuous, like one who has completely transcended sorrow.

original: mchog tu bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu bde ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not concomitant with virtue, like feeling and so on,

original: ldan pa ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: kun nas slong ba las kyang ma yin te /

analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bzhin du yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe skyes nas 'thob pa dag ji ltar dge ba nyid yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe skyes nas 'thob pa dag ji ltar dge ba nyid yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, you must explain how virtuous states obtained from birth are virtuous when linking at death.üîΩYou must explain how they are virtuous.

original: ji ltar dge ba nyid yin pa ni brjod dgos so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di la 'bad par bya dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba nyid yin pa ni brjod dgos so zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di la 'bad par bya dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //

original: 'di la lan ni dge ba'i rtsa bas kun nas bslang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs nyid na dge ba yin la nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis ni de dag gi thob pa'i gags sel bar byed kyi dge ba
analyzed: 'di la lan ni dge ba'i rtsa bas kun nas bslang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs nyid na dge ba yin la nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis ni de dag gi thob pa'i gags sel bar byed kyi dge ba
translated: The answer to this is that since they are motivated by roots of virtue, they are virtuous in the future state itself. But when they are obstructed by afflicted minds, they are not virtuous.

original: nyid du byed pa ni med do zhes lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: nyid du byed pa ni med do zhes lan 'debs par byed do //

original: sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di la sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid de ngo bo nyid yod pas sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di la sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid de ngo bo nyid yod pas sdug bsngal thams cad 'jug pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúBecause it is the nature of all suffering to enter it,‚Äù means that because the nature of suffering to enter it exists in it, all suffering enters it.

original: des na 'khor ba ni don dam par mi dge ba yin no ;
analyzed: des na 'khor ba ni don dam par mi dge ba yin no ;
translated: Therefore, samsara is ultimately nonvirtuous.

original: / lus dang ngag gi las dang skye ba la sogs ba zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid sdom pa ma yin pa dang sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yinüîΩpa yang ma yin pas bsdus pa dang skye ba la sogs pa ste /

translated: ‚ÄúBodily and verbal action, birth, etc.‚Äù means bodily and verbal action, which is the nature of intimation and non-intimation, included in neither moral training nor non-moral training, and birth, etc.

original: skye ba dang / @18b rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnams dang / mi dge ba dag gis thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba dang / @18b rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rnams dang / mi dge ba dag gis thob pa rnams so //
translated: Birth, aging, duration, and non-eternality, which are the characteristics and secondary characteristics, and the obtainment of non-virtuous things.

original: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pas dper bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dpe ni nad kyis bya ste /
analyzed: nad dang mi 'phrod pa'i sman la sogs pas dper bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dpe ni nad kyis bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should understand through examples such as illness, unwholesome medicine, etc.‚Äù means that the example of sa·πÉsƒÅra is illness.

analyzed: 'khor ba ni nad dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Sa·πÉsƒÅra is like an illness‚Äîthis is the meaning.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i dpe ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman gyis bya ste /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i dpe ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman gyis bya ste /

analyzed: gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang kun nas bslang ba la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro //
