analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dpe ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung bas bya'o//
translated: The example of those that are concomitant is like a drink mixed with unwholesome medicine.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dang skye ba la sogs pa dang thob pa rnams kyi dpe ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las byung ba'i 'o mas bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dang skye ba la sogs pa dang thob pa rnams kyi dpe ni mi 'phrod pa'i sman dang sbyar ba'i btung ba las byung ba'i 'o mas bya'o //
translated: The example of bodily and verbal actions, birth, etc., and acquisitions is like the milk that comes from a drink mixed with unwholesome medicine.

original: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te 'khor ba don dam par mi dge ba yin na zag pa dang bcas pa ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa cung zad kyang lung du ma bstan pa'am dge bar miüîΩ'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te 'khor ba don dam par mi dge ba yin na zag pa dang bcas pa ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa cung zad kyang lung du ma bstan pa'am dge bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If samsara is unwholesome in the ultimate sense, then nothing that is contaminated could be neutral or wholesome, because it is included in samsara.üîΩThis is the objection.

original: don dam par de skad du bshad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa thams cad mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khas len to //
analyzed: don dam par de skad du bshad kyi zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa thams cad mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni khas len to //
translated: We accept that all that is included in samsara is unwholesome, but we explain this in the ultimate sense.

original: rnam par smin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang zhig 'di ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang zhig 'di ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is because it is said that that which is called neutral because it is karmic maturation is neutral.

original: 'di skad du zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par mi bde ba'i phyir mi dge ba yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad du zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par mi bde ba'i phyir mi dge ba yang yin la /
translated: This is because that which is contaminated is nonvirtuous because it is ultimately associated with suffering.

original: rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not neutral because it is karmic maturation.

original: dge ba yang de kho na bzhin du mi dge ba yang yin la rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can yin pa'i phyir dge ba'ang yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba yang de kho na bzhin du mi dge ba yang yin la rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can yin pa'i phyir dge ba'ang yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that virtue is also like that. That which is nonvirtuous is also virtuous because it is karmic maturation that is pleasant.

original: gal te kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems pa kho na dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin no snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis lus dang ngag gi las kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid spyod pa yin no
analyzed: gal te kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems pa kho na dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid yin no snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis lus dang ngag gi las kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid spyod pa yin no
translated: If you think that karma is virtuous or nonvirtuous due to the motivating mind, then physical and verbal karma would be virtuous or nonvirtuous due to the motivating mind.

original: // ci ste 'byung ba chen po rnams ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid de /üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyis ni lus dang ngag gi las dang / de dag gi 'byung ba @19a * //
analyzed: // ci ste 'byung ba chen po rnams ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid de / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems kyis ni lus dang ngag gi las dang / de dag gi 'byung ba @19a * //
translated: But the primary elements are not virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: chen po rnams kyang kun nas slong bar byed do //
analyzed: chen po rnams kyang kun nas slong bar byed do //
translated: The mind that is virtuous or nonvirtuous motivates physical and verbal karma and the primary elements that are the basis of that karma.

original: bye brag tu smra bas smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas smras pa /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:

original: byed pa po ni las la sems pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa po ni las la sems pa yin gyi /
translated: The agent is the mind that intends to perform an action.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag bya'o snyam du 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag bya'o snyam du 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: The primary elements do not think, We will create this.

original: 'o na ci zhe na las 'di bya'o snyam du sems pa yin pas 'byung ba chen po rnams ni las bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na las 'di bya'o snyam du sems pa yin pas 'byung ba chen po rnams ni las bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: What is it? It is the thought ‚ÄúI will do this action.‚Äù Thus the great elements are not virtuous or nonvirtuous like action.

original: slob dpon gyis bshad pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bshad pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la ni /
translated: Vasubandhu explains:

original: byed pa po la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bya'o snyam du bsam pa med do //üîΩmnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems ni sa'i sgo nas mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pas skal ba mi mnyam zhing mi 'dra ba'i phyir de kun nas slong bar byed pa de lta bur sems par byed pa gang yin pa yod pa ma yin na ji ltar mnyam
analyzed: byed pa po la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bya'o snyam du bsam pa med do // mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems ni sa'i sgo nas mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pas skal ba mi mnyam zhing mi 'dra ba'i phyir de kun nas slong bar byed pa de lta bur sems par byed pa gang yin pa yod pa ma yin na ji ltar mnyam
translated: In meditative equipoise, there is no intention to perform nonindicative form.

original: par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de dge ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: par gzhag pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de dge ba nyid yin te /
translated: The mind of nonmeditative equipoise is not equipoise because it is not homogeneous and similar to the mind of meditative equipoise. If there is no such intention that motivates it, how could nonindicative form in meditative equipoise be virtuous?

original: de ni 'byung ba chen po bzhin du dge ba nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'byung ba chen po bzhin du dge ba nyid yin par mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It would not be virtuous like the four great elements.

original: yang na lha'i mig la sogs pa dang rna ba dag kyang dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te sems pa med du zin kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dge ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na lha'i mig la sogs pa dang rna ba dag kyang dge ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te sems pa med du zin kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dge ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If nonindicative form is virtuous even though it does not possess intention,

original: yang na 'di'i 'brel pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di'i 'brel pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: then the connection is as follows.

original: gal te skal ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi dbang gis de dge ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te skal ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi dbang gis de dge ba nyid yin na /
translated: If it is virtuous due to the power of the mind that is not equipoise and of a different realm,

original: lha'i mig dang rna ba dag kyang sbyor ba'i tshe de dag la sems pa yod pa'i phyir dge ba nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩrna mig mngon shes lung ma bstan //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang rna ba dag kyang sbyor ba'i tshe de dag la sems pa yod pa'i phyir dge ba nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na / rna mig mngon shes lung ma bstan //
translated: then it follows that the divine eye and ear would be virtuous because intention exists in relation to them when one is preparing to engage in them.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de gnyis la ni dge ba nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir de gnyis la ni dge ba nyid kyang med do //
translated: But they are not virtuous because it is said,üîΩThe higher perceptions of the ear and eye are neutral.

original: mthong bas na spang bar bya ba ni kha nang du bltas par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir de skad du smra bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa /
analyzed: mthong bas na spang bar bya ba ni kha nang du bltas par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir de skad du smra bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems ni rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa /
translated: Because it is said that that which is abandoned by the path of seeing is internalized, this passage explains that a mind abandoned by the path of seeing does not motivate indicative form.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs she na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs she na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ni /

analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa dang 'gal lo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This contradicts the Bhagavan's statement.üîΩWhat is that?

original: de yang gang zhe na log par lta ba de las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na log par lta ba de las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: From that wrong view, wrong action and wrong livelihood arise.

original: ji ltar log par lta ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba las log pa'i dag rnam par rig byed kyi @19b ngo bo nyid dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' de'i ngo bo nyid kho na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs rgyu dang ni /

translated: The Bhagavan said that from wrong view abandoned by the path of seeing, wrong action and wrong livelihood arise, which are by nature indicative form and nonindicative form.

original: de yi dus kyi slong zhes bya //
analyzed: de yi dus kyi slong zhes bya //
translated: And that which motivates it at that time.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i slong ba dang de'i dus kyi slong ba ni rgyu dang dus kyi slong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i slong ba dang de'i dus kyi slong ba ni rgyu dang dus kyi slong ba'o //
translated: The causal instigation and the instigation at the time are the causal and temporal instigations.üîΩThe designation of the name ‚Äúcausal and temporal instigation‚Äù is the causal and temporal instigation.

original: rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes ming btags pa ni rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong pa zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes ming btags pa ni rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong pa zhes bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa'o //
translated: This is the designation of the name.

original: yang 'di la rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes bya ba yod pas na /üîΩrgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes bya ba can yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di la rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes bya ba yod pas na / rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes bya ba can yin te /
translated: Moreover, since the causal and temporal instigation exists in this,üîΩit is called ‚Äúhaving the causal and temporal instigation.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang de'i dus kyi slong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the causal and temporal instigation.

original: rgyu dang dus kyi slong ba zhes bya bar ming du btags pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang dus kyi slong ba zhes bya bar ming du btags pa yin no //
translated: It is designated by the name ‚Äúcausal and temporal instigation.‚Äù

original: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis kun nas slong bas na kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas slong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis kun nas slong bas na kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: The causal instigation is the instigation by this, therefore it is the instigation.

original: de ni rgyu yang yin la de ni kun nas slong ba yang yin pas rgyu'i kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu yang yin la de ni kun nas slong ba yang yin pas rgyu'i kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: It is the cause and it is the instigation, therefore it is the causal instigation.

original: de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba zhes bya ba ni dus de ste bya ba'i dus so //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba zhes bya ba ni dus de ste bya ba'i dus so //
translated: The so-called instigation at that time is the time of the action.

original: dus der kun nas slong ba ni de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba'o //
analyzed: dus der kun nas slong ba ni de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba'o //
translated: The instigation at that time is the instigation at the time of the action.

original: de'i dus kho na na de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i dus kho na na de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dus kho na na de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i dus kho na na de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it exists at that time alone means because the instigation at the time of the action exists at the time of the action alone.

original: 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩda ni bya ba de la de'i nus pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni da ni rnam par rig byed kyi bya ba de la de'i dus kyi kun nas slong bar byed pa de'i nus pa ji zhig yod na gang gis na de'i tshe de'i rjes su
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro // da ni bya ba de la de'i nus pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni da ni rnam par rig byed kyi bya ba de la de'i dus kyi kun nas slong bar byed pa de'i nus pa ji zhig yod na gang gis na de'i tshe de'i rjes su
translated: Because it is the propelling cause means because it is the generating cause.üîΩNow, what is the potency of that action?

original: 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Now, what is the potency of that instigation at the time of the action with regard to that action of informative form, by which it is said that it is the subsequent instigator at that time?

original: de med na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyu'i kun nas slong bas 'phangs su zin cing bskyed du zin kyang de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba de med na shi ba bzhin du rnam par rig byed yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rgyu'i kun nas slong bas 'phangs su zin cing bskyed du zin kyang de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba de med na shi ba bzhin du rnam par rig byed yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not exist, then even though the instigation of the cause has projected and generated it, if the instigation of that moment does not exist, then like a dead person, indicative form would not exist.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig grong du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'phangs nas bar ma dor shin de la rjes su 'jug par byed par sems med pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de de dang 'dra'o //üîΩ'o na sems med pa'i sdom pa skye ba la zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig grong du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'phangs nas bar ma dor shin de la rjes su 'jug par byed par sems med pa'i phyir 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de de dang 'dra'o // 'o na sems med pa'i sdom pa skye ba la zhes bya ba rgyas bar 'byung ba ni /
translated: For example, if someone projects, ‚ÄúI will go to the village,‚Äù but dies in the interim, he does not go there because he lacks the mind to engage in going.üîΩIf indicative form does not exist in the absence of the instigation of that moment, then like a dead person, it would not exist.

original: gal te de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba med pa na shi ba bzhin du de yod par mi 'gyur na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la lus kyi rnam par rig byed byas pa 'ga' zhig de'i tshe 'gog pa'i
analyzed: gal te de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba med pa na shi ba bzhin du de yod par mi 'gyur na 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pas bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba la lus kyi rnam par rig byed byas pa 'ga' zhig de'i tshe 'gog pa'i
translated: If one who has obtained the meditative attainment of cessation generates the vows of individual liberation, then at that time, like a dead person, he would not have any indicative form.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir sems @20a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir sems @20a * //
translated: Because meditative attainment is present,

original: med pa'i sdom pa skye ba la de'i sdom par gtogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed las brjod pa'i 'jug pa 'byung ba ji ltar yod de /
analyzed: med pa'i sdom pa skye ba la de'i sdom par gtogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig byed las brjod pa'i 'jug pa 'byung ba ji ltar yod de /
translated: the vows of the mindless states arise. But how could the engagement of the verbal action that is included in those vows arise from physical informative form?

original: de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba med na /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi kun nas slong ba med na /
translated: If there is no motivation at that time,üîΩhow could it arise?

original: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus he explains the contradiction.

original: de ltar 'gal bar bshad pa dang / 'o na ni sems dang bcas pa la ches gsal ba yin zhes bya ba lan gzhan la rten par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar 'gal bar bshad pa dang / 'o na ni sems dang bcas pa la ches gsal ba yin zhes bya ba lan gzhan la rten par byed de /
translated: But if you say that it is clear that it exists when the mind is present, he relies on another response:

original: de'i dus kyi kun nas slong bas ni sems dang bcas pa la rnam par rig byed ces gsal bar 'byung bas de'i nus pa ni de yin no //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi kun nas slong bas ni sems dang bcas pa la rnam par rig byed ces gsal bar 'byung bas de'i nus pa ni de yin no //
translated: The motivation at that time clearly indicates that the informative form exists when the mind is present.

original: mthong bas spang bya'i rnam shes ni //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bya'i rnam shes ni //
translated: The consciousness to be abandoned by the path of seeingüîΩis the instigator.

original: rab tu 'jug byed yin zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug byed yin zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa kho na yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: This passage indicates that consciousness to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the instigator.

original: ji ltar de rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin zhe na kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi gzhir gyur cing rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin zhe na kun nas slong bar byed pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi gzhir gyur cing rgyur gyur pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: How does it instigate? It instigates informative form because it is the basis and cause of the investigation and analysis that instigate it.üîΩIt is not a subsequent instigator, because it is not a subsequent instigator of the mind that is directed outward.

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kha phyir bltas la rjes su 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par rig byed kyi bya ba'i dus gang yin pa de na de med pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni sems kha phyir bltas la rjes su 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par rig byed kyi bya ba'i dus gang yin pa de na de med pa'i phyir ro
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the action of informative form does not exist at the time‚Äù means that the action of informative form does not exist at the time that the mind that is directed outward is a subsequent instigator.

original: // rab tu 'jug par byed pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: // rab tu 'jug par byed pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no instigator that is abandoned by the path of seeing‚Äù means that there is no instigator that is abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de'i phyir de ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //üîΩnyes pa gzhan des kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rjes su 'jug par byed pa ma yin no // nyes pa gzhan des kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba 'di yang yod de /
translated: Therefore, it is not a subsequent instigator.

original: gal te mthong bas spang bar bya ba de yang /
analyzed: gal te mthong bas spang bar bya ba de yang /
translated: There is another fault: The phrase ‚Äúform that is motivated by it‚Äù means that if the action of informative form is motivated by a mind that is abandoned by the path of seeing,üîΩthen the action of informative form would be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin na ji ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba de'i sems des kun nas bslang ba'i lus
analyzed: de rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin na ji ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin pa ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba de'i sems des kun nas bslang ba'i lus
translated: If it is concomitant with that, then just as physical and verbal karma motivated by the mind that is an object to be abandoned by the path of meditation is to be abandoned by the path of meditation, so too the mind that is an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing would motivate physical and verbal karma that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩ

original: dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is concomitant with that, then just as physical and verbal karma motivated by the mind that is an object to be abandoned by the path of meditation is an object to be abandoned by the path of meditation, then physical and verbal indicative form motivated by the mind that is an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing would also be an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: cir 'gyur zhes zer ba ni rgol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes zer ba ni rgol bar byed pa'o //
translated: What would be the problem?üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says, it would contradict the Abhidharma.

original: bye brag tu smra bas chos mngon pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩnyon mongs can min mthong spangs min //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas chos mngon pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te / nyon mongs can min mthong spangs min //
translated: It would contradict the Abhidharma because it says:

original: gzugs min zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs min zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonindicative form is not neutral nor is it an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzhan yang rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: It also would contradict the Abhidharma because it would not be contradictory for both knowledge and ignorance to exist simultaneously.

original: gzugs de ni @20b 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin du rig pa mthong ba'i lam dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs de ni @20b 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa bzhin du rig pa mthong ba'i lam dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: That form is not contradictory to knowledge because it is not contradictory for both the view of the transitory collection and so on and knowledge of the path of seeing to exist simultaneously.

original: ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not abandoned.

original: de'i phyir de ni bden pa mthong ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pas gzugs ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bden pa mthong ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pas gzugs ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, even those who see the truth possess form, and thus form is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ma rig pa dang 'gal ba yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'gal ba yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Also, it is not contradictory to ignorance.

original: ji ltar zag pa med pa'i lam so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na de ni skye ba'i phyir la de skyes te 'phags pa'i gnas skabs na ni ma rig pa kha cig spangs pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang 'gal ba ltar gzugs ni ma rig pa dang 'gal
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa med pa'i lam so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na de ni skye ba'i phyir la de skyes te 'phags pa'i gnas skabs na ni ma rig pa kha cig spangs pa'i phyir ma rig pa dang 'gal ba ltar gzugs ni ma rig pa dang 'gal
translated: Just as the uncontaminated path is not contradictory to ignorance, because it arises in the state of ordinary beings, and when it arises in the state of ƒÅryas, some ignorance is abandoned,

original: ba med de /
analyzed: ba med de /
translated: form is not contradictory to ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gzugs kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs sam / de'i thob pa'i rgyun chags pa'i tshe yang ma rig pa mi 'byung ba ma yin la ma rig pa yod na yang de mi 'byung ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gzugs kun du 'byung ba'i gnas skabs sam / de'i thob pa'i rgyun chags pa'i tshe yang ma rig pa mi 'byung ba ma yin la ma rig pa yod na yang de mi 'byung ba ma yin pas so //
translated: Because ignorance does not arise when afflicted or unafflicted form arises, or when the continuum of its obtainment is continuous, and when ignorance exists, it does not arise.

original: de lta bu yin la zag pa med pa bzhin du spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu yin la zag pa med pa bzhin du spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: gal te spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin la mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma yin na shugs kyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba grub po /
translated: If it is not an object to be abandoned and it is not an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing, it is established that it is an object to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

analyzed: cig shos kyis gzugs rig pa dang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: gang zhig gzugs mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'dod de ji ltar gzugs rig pa dang mi 'gal bar 'dzin par 'gyur /

analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas 'o na ni sems mtshungs pas bslang ba'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says: In that case, the elements are also similar because they are generated by the mind.

original: gal te mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par gyur na 'o na ni de'i rten 'byung ba rnams kyang mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de dag ni de lta bu yin par yang mi 'os te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: cig shos kyis de ltar ni mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba smas te /

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag tu ni mi @21a * //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag tu ni mi @21a * //

original: 'gyur ro // ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dag tu mi 'gyur ba bzhin te /

original: ji ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems gang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gzugs kun nas bslang ba de nyid kyis de'i rten gyis 'byung ba rnams kyang kun nas bslang ba yin na /

analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi gzugs de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin gyi de'i rten gyi 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o // yang de nyid kyis bzlog ste /
translated: the form that is the intrinsic nature of the karma of body and speech is virtuous or nonvirtuous, but the primary elements that are its basis are not.üîΩThe VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas respond: They would be objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: yang na mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par gyur du zad mod ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: yang na mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par gyur du zad mod ces bya ba smras so //
translated: The author of the commentary responds: Or they would be objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

analyzed: bye brag tu smras pas de skad brjod par ni mi nus te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say: That cannot be said.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin par zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin par zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat are to be abandoned by the path of seeing‚Äù is a remainder.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ni rig pa dang ma rig pa dag dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because non-defiled dharmas are not incompatible with either ignorance or knowledge.üîΩNon-defiled dharmas, i.e., unobscured indeterminate dharmas and virtuous contaminated dharmas, are not incompatible with the uncontaminated path of knowledge,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i chos ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni ji ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dag thob pa 'chad pas 'gal ba ltar rig pa zag pa med pa'i lam dang 'galüîΩba med do //üîΩde la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa thob pa 'chad pa'i phyir 'gal ba ni mi 'gog go //

translated: The obtainment of the defilements that focus on them is severed, but the severance of the defilements that focus on them is not incompatible with them.üîΩThe obtainment of the defilements that focus on them is severed, but the severance of the defilements that focus on them is not incompatible with them.

analyzed: de la yang na gyur du zad mod ces smras pa de yang rig pa ma yin te / de ltar na 'dir bsgrub pa 'byung ste / nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs kyi rten 'byung ba rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: But that is not logical.üîΩüîΩThus, this is established here:üîΩThe primary elements that are the basis of afflicted form are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.üîΩ

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bzhin no // bye brag tu smra bas de ltar mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par shes pa ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes klan ka dang bcas pa'i lan so sor bkod nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de lta bas na mdo las rgyu'i kun nas slong
translated: It is not logical to say that the elements that are the basis of afflicted form are objects abandoned by the path of seeing because they are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, like nonafflicted states such as the mind and mental factors of the absorptions.üîΩThe Vaibhasikas respond to this objection by saying that consciousness to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the instigator of the elements.

original: ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: They conclude that therefore the sutra states that the motivating cause is the afflicted view of the self and so on.

analyzed: zag pa med pa ni gnyi ga ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jug par byed pa yang ma yin la rjes su 'jug par byed pa yang ma yin pa ste /

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni kha nang du bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dman par 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni ldang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: dge bar rgyud gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dge bar rgyud gcig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni mdo las glang po che yin par gsungs so //
translated: The Lord Buddha is called an elephant in the sutras.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?üîΩThe sutra states:

original: 'char byed de bzhin gshegs pa ni lha dang bcas shing bdud dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten na zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs nas sku dang gsung dang thugs kyis ngan pa mi mdzad de de lta bas na glang po chen po zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /

translated: because they increase the abandonment of taking life and so on, and because they increase the vows not previously existing to abandon dancing, singing, music, and so on?

original: phyogs gcig khyad par du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas gzhan dang gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog gam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyogs gcig khyad par du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas gzhan dang gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog gam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Do they differ from each other because they possess different qualities, or are they posited as different states due to possessing different aspects?

original: 'on te dge bsnyen gyi srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: 'on te dge bsnyen gyi srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa yang gzhan yin la /
translated: Or are the vows of a layperson to abandon taking life and so on different from the vows of a novice,üîΩand the vows of a novice are different from the vows of a monk?üîΩOr do they differ because they possess different qualities?

original: dge tshul gyi yang de las gzhan yin ;
analyzed: dge tshul gyi yang de las gzhan yin ;
translated: The vows of a novice are different from those and the vows of a fully ordained monk are different from those.

original: dge slong gi yang de las gzhan no zhes bya ba lta bur de dag thams cad tha dad pa nyid gcig tu skye ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi yang de las gzhan no zhes bya ba lta bur de dag thams cad tha dad pa nyid gcig tu skye ste /
translated: All of these are generated as one, but they are distinct from each other.

original: dge slong gi rgyud gcig la srog gcod pa spong ba gsum yod la /
analyzed: dge slong gi rgyud gcig la srog gcod pa spong ba gsum yod la /
translated: In the mindstream of a fully ordained monk there are three vows abandoning taking life,

original: ma byin par len pa spong ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spong ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa zhig yin nam /
translated: and it is similar for abandoning taking what is not given and so on.üîΩThe remaining vows are similar to that.

original: lhag ma rnams @23b kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gar dang glu dang rol mo spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams @23b kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni gar dang glu dang rol mo spong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The remaining vows are abandoning dancing, singing and playing music and so on.üîΩOne turns away from many bases of taking life and so on.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ches mang po dag las ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge bsnyen pas dge tshul srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ches mang po dag las ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ches mang po dag las ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge bsnyen pas dge tshul srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ches mang po dag las ldog pa yin te /
translated: The layperson turns away from many bases of taking life and so on.

original: dper na dus ma yin pa'i zas srog gcod pa'i gzhir 'gyur la de las ni dge tshul ldog gi dge bsnyen ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na dus ma yin pa'i zas srog gcod pa'i gzhir 'gyur la de las ni dge tshul ldog gi dge bsnyen ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: For example, eating at the wrong time is a basis for taking life, but a novice monk does not stop that, but a layperson does.

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta bu zhig yin par ma gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te de lta bu zhig yin par ma gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: If that were not so,

original: dge bsnyen dang dge tshul gyi sdom pa gnyi ga yang dge slong gi sdom pa de 'dus pa'i phyir dge slong gi sdom pa gtang zhing bor bas dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa la sogs pa gsum char yang gtang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang dge tshul gyi sdom pa gnyi ga yang dge slong gi sdom pa de 'dus pa'i phyir dge slong gi sdom pa gtang zhing bor bas dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa la sogs pa gsum char yang gtang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if that were not so, then the vows of a layperson and a novice monk would both be included in the vows of a fully ordained monk, because if the vows of a fully ordained monk were relinquished and abandoned, then all three, the vows of a layperson and so on, would be relinquished.

original: spong ba yang dag par blang bas zhes bya ba ni spong ba ni rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spong ba yang dag par blang bas zhes bya ba ni spong ba ni rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Correct acceptance of abandonment refers to abandonment and the indicative and nonindicative form that is explained below.

original: yang dag par 'jog par byed pas zhes bya ba ni so sor yang dag par 'god par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog par byed pas zhes bya ba ni so sor yang dag par 'god par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is correctly established‚Äù means ‚Äúit is correctly established for each individual.‚Äù

original: sdig pa'i lam rnams ni sems can dag la mi mnyam par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i lam rnams ni sems can dag la mi mnyam par 'jug par byed do //
translated: Evil paths are those that engage unequally with sentient beings.

original: de yang rnam par rig byed dang sems dag gis byed pas na zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed kyis byed la /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rig byed dang sems dag gis byed pas na zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rnam par rig byed kyis byed la /
translated: And that is done by both informative form and mind means that noninformative form that is included in the restraint of individual liberation is done by informative form.

original: bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de ni sems kyis byed de ting nge 'dzin gyis byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa de ni sems kyis byed de ting nge 'dzin gyis byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Noninformative form that is included in the restraint of meditative absorption and uncontaminated vows is done by mind, which means it is done by meditative stabilization.

original: de ltar na bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni las su sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bya ba yin zhes bya ba ni las su sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is an action means that it is established as an action.

original: bya ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te sdom pa la gnas pa na sdom pa kun du bsrung ba'i phyir rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba rtsom mo //
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te sdom pa la gnas pa na sdom pa kun du bsrung ba'i phyir rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi bya ba rtsom mo //
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of action‚Äù means that it is the cause of action because when one who possesses vows undertakes the action characterized by informative form in order to guard the vows.

original: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is the result of action‚Äù means that it is the result of action characterized by informative form.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ji ltar bya ba yin na de yang ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i sems pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung ba ji ltar bya ba yin na de yang ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i sems pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bya ba yin no //
translated: How can that which arises from concentration be action? It is action because it is the result of intention that arises from concentration.

original: yang na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, because this is the context of the vows of individual liberation.

original: de ltar re zhig bye brag med par so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par bstan to zhes bya ba ni skad @24a * //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bye brag med par so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par bstan to zhes bya ba ni skad @24a * //
translated: Thus, the vows of individual liberation have been taught without distinction.

original: cig ma dang po dang skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: cig ma dang po dang skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The first moment and the second moment, etc. are also pratimoksa vows.

original: so sor thar pa ni skad cig ma dang po kho na yin pas de'i phyir yang /
analyzed: so sor thar pa ni skad cig ma dang po kho na yin pas de'i phyir yang /
translated: Since pratimoksa is only the first moment, therefore it is said:

original: dang po'i rnam rig rnam rig min //
analyzed: dang po'i rnam rig rnam rig min //
translated: The first moment of consciousness is not consciousness.

original: so sor thar zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos so//
analyzed: so sor thar zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smos so//
translated: It is called pratimoksa.

original: des sdig pa las so sor thar pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po kho nas sdig pa las so sor thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sdig pa las so sor thar pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po kho nas sdig pa las so sor thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it liberates from evil means that by the first moment alone one is liberated from evil.

original: spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it abandons means because it discards.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba ni 'di ni so sor thar pa yang yin la lus dang ngag dag sdom pa'i phyir sdom pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes kyang bya zhes bya ba ni 'di ni so sor thar pa yang yin la lus dang ngag dag sdom pa'i phyir sdom pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is also called a pratimoksa vow means that it is pratimoksa and a vow because it restrains body and speech.

original: las kyi lam zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni las kyi lam dngos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las kyi lam zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni las kyi lam dngos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúpath of action‚Äù means the actual path of action.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i sdom kho na yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i sdom kho na yin te /
translated: In the second moment and so on, it is the restraint of individual liberation.

original: so sor thar pa dang 'dra ba'am so sor thar pa las skyes pa'i sdom pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang 'dra ba'am so sor thar pa las skyes pa'i sdom pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: The restraint that is similar to or arises from individual liberation is the restraint of individual liberation.

original: so sor thar pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not individual liberation.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po kho nas thar par byas zin pa'i phyir des sdig pa las so sor thar par mi byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma dang po kho nas thar par byas zin pa'i phyir des sdig pa las so sor thar par mi byed pas so //
translated: Because it is already liberated by the first moment alone, it does not liberate from evil.üîΩThe eight types are definitely exhausted.

original: ris brgyad kho nar zad do zhes nges par gzung ba dang yang phyi rol pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'dri bar byed de /
analyzed: ris brgyad kho nar zad do zhes nges par gzung ba dang yang phyi rol pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'dri bar byed de /
translated: The question is asked in detail: ‚ÄúAre there also non-Buddhist restrains?‚Äù

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims zhes khyad par du byas pa ni tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims zhes khyad par du byas pa ni tshul khrims rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualification ‚Äúmorality that is taken up‚Äù is made because there are two types of morality.

original: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of morality:

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims dang chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims dang chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
translated: Morality is also twofold: morality assumed through a rite and morality obtained from the intrinsic nature of the object.

original: de la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni 'di dang 'di mi bya'o zhes mnos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims ni 'di dang 'di mi bya'o zhes mnos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Morality assumed through a rite is that which is assumed by saying, ‚ÄúI will not do this or that.‚Äù

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Morality obtained from the intrinsic nature of the object is the restraint of meditation and the uncontaminated restraint.üîΩBecause they are based on existence means that, although they seek liberation, they are ruined by wrong views, etc.

original: srid pa la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dag thar pa don du gnyer du zin kyang log par lta ba la sogs pas nyams pa'i phyir dang / de dag kha cig srid pa'i khyad par kho na la thar pa yin par sems pas srid pa la brten pa'i tshul khrims kho na yin no //
analyzed: srid pa la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de dag thar pa don du gnyer du zin kyang log par lta ba la sogs pas nyams pa'i phyir dang / de dag kha cig srid pa'i khyad par kho na la thar pa yin par sems pas srid pa la brten pa'i tshul khrims kho na yin no //
translated: And some of them think that a particular existence is liberation, so they have only morality based on existence.

original: de'i phyir de dag la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, they have morality assumed through a rite,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the prƒÅtimok·π£a restraint.

original: 'dir ni nyer bsdogs kyang bsam gtan du brjod nas bstan te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig phyir nyer bsdogs @24b na yang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yod par 'dod pa de'i phyir 'dir ni bsam gtan gyi nyer bsdogs kyang bsamüîΩgtan zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni nyer bsdogs kyang bsam gtan du brjod nas bstan te zhes bya ba ni gang zhig phyir nyer bsdogs @24b na yang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yod par 'dod pa de'i phyir 'dir ni bsam gtan gyi nyer bsdogs kyang bsam gtan zhes bya ba'i sgrar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore here the access concentrations to the absorptions are also called meditative stabilization.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos gzhi yang bsdu bar bya ba de kho na yin no //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni dngos gzhi yang bsdu bar bya ba de kho na yin no //
translated: The word also includes the actual bases.üîΩThe condition of simultaneous arising

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen bshad par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rkyen bshad par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is explained as:üîΩThe two vows and intention

original: sems pa dang ni sdom gnyis dang // de dag gi ni zhes bya ba dor ro //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni sdom gnyis dang // de dag gi ni zhes bya ba dor ro //
translated: arise simultaneously with the mind.üîΩFrom among these three

original: gsum po 'di dag las zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnams las so //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag las zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa rnams las so //
translated: the prƒÅtimok·π£a vows, the absorptive meditative stabilization vows, and the uncontaminated vows,

original: sems gzhan dang ldan pa dang sems med pa'ang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng sems med pa'i yang //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang ldan pa dang sems med pa'ang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng sems med pa'i yang //
translated: Because it engages with other minds and also with no mind.üîΩ

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmi lcogs pa med la zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kho na las so sor thar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // mi lcogs pa med la zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kho na las so sor thar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is concomitant with other minds and also occurs when there is no mind.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dag tu zhes bya ba ni de dag spong ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dag tu zhes bya ba ni de dag spong ba'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the uninterrupted path‚Äù means in the nine uninterrupted paths that abandon the nine stages of affliction of the desire realm.

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the motivating factor‚Äù means it is the motivating factor of immorality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dag la de rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir mu bzhir bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dag la de rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir mu bzhir bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is posited in the uninterrupted paths of unrestricted access concentration, four possibilities can be constructed.

original: mu dang po ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ma gtogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ste mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag la yod pa dang bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dngos gzhi'i bar chad med pa dang /
analyzed: mu dang po ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam ma gtogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ste mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag la yod pa dang bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar dngos gzhi'i bar chad med pa dang /
translated: The first possibility is the absorption vows of contaminated states, except for the uninterrupted path of unrestricted access concentration, which exist on the unrestricted access concentration, the liberated path, the path of preparation and the special path and the actual basis of the first absorption and so on up to the fourth absorption, which exist on the uninterrupted path, the liberated path, the path of preparation and the special path.

original: rnam par grol ba dang sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag la bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yod pa gang yin pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yin gyi spong ba'i sdom pa ni ma yin te nges 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni mi spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag la bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yod pa gang yin pa ni bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yin gyi spong ba'i sdom pa ni ma yin te nges 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni mi spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is absorption vows is not abandoning vows because they do not abandon unethical conduct and the afflictions that motivate it.

original: gnyis pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dag tu zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dag tu zag pa med pa ste /
translated: The second possibility is uncontaminated vows on the nine uninterrupted paths of unrestricted access concentration.

original: 'di ni de lta bu kho nas 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir spong ba'i sdom pa yin gyi bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ni ma yin te zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad @25a * //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta bu kho nas 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir spong ba'i sdom pa yin gyi bsam gtan gyi sdom pa ni ma yin te zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro // gsum pa ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i bar chad @25a * //
translated: It is an abandoning vow that abandons immorality and so on, but it is not a meditative stabilization vow because it is uncontaminated.

original: med pa'i lam dag tu thag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: med pa'i lam dag tu thag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The third is the vow possessed in the uninterrupted paths of unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption.

original: 'di ni nges 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir spong ba'i sdom pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni nges 'chal ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir spong ba'i sdom pa yang yin la /
translated: It is an abandoning vow that abandons immorality and so on,

original: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yang yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa yang yin te /
translated: and it is a meditative stabilization vow

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from contaminated concentration.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin la nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin la nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yod do zhes bshad do //
translated: But there are also secondary afflictions that are not afflictions.

original: rten gnyi ga'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi rten can gyi nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi so sor rtog pa mi bzod pa'i phyir dang ngo tsha shes pa dang /
analyzed: rten gnyi ga'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni skyes pa dang bud med kyi rten can gyi nyon mongs pa shas che ba'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi so sor rtog pa mi bzod pa'i phyir dang ngo tsha shes pa dang /
translated: Afflictions of both types are extensive because they are the afflictions of both male and female bases, they are not endured by the discernment that is the antidote to them and they are ashamed of them.

original: khrel yod pa shas chen po med pa'i phyir de dag la sdom pa med do //
analyzed: khrel yod pa shas chen po med pa'i phyir de dag la sdom pa med do //
translated: The extensive explanation of the afflictions of both types of basis is that they do not possess vows because they have a predominance of afflictions that are the basis of male and female, they are unable to cultivate discernment that is the antidote to that and they lack a predominance of shame and embarrassment.

original: gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Because they are antidotes,

original: sdom pa ni sdom pa ma yin pa'i gnyen por gyur pa de'i phyir gang la sdom pa yod pa de kho na la sdom pa ma yin pa med de /
analyzed: sdom pa ni sdom pa ma yin pa'i gnyen por gyur pa de'i phyir gang la sdom pa yod pa de kho na la sdom pa ma yin pa med de /
translated: vows are antidotes to negative commitments. Therefore, those who possess vows do not possess negative commitments.

original: 'di ni za ma la sogs pa la sdom pa ma yin pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni za ma la sogs pa la sdom pa ma yin pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second reason that eunuchs and so on do not possess negative commitments.

original: yang dag par len pa dang ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len pa med pa'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa med la /
analyzed: yang dag par len pa dang ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len pa med pa'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pa med la /
translated: Because they lack correct adoption and concentration.üîΩBecause they lack correct adoption, they lack the pratimoksa vow.

original: ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag med do //
translated: Because they lack concentration, they lack the dhyana and uncontaminated vows.

original: @42b de med pa ni dge ba dag la zhen pas mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @42b de med pa ni dge ba dag la zhen pas mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not arise because they are not attached to virtue.

original: sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir sdom pa ma yin pa med do //
analyzed: sdig pa bya ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir sdom pa ma yin pa med do //
translated: They do not have negative commitments because they do not have the intention to commit evil.

original: gang dang ldan pa dang gang med pas zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba rnams la ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa gang dang ldan pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa gang med pas go rims bzhin du sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas chen po de med pas so //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pa dang gang med pas zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba rnams la ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa gang dang ldan pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa gang med pas go rims bzhin du sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa shas chen po de med pas so //
translated: Because they lack shame and embarrassment means that because they lack the strong shame and embarrassment that would be the basis for the vows and negative commitments, respectively, they do not have vows and negative commitments.

original: gal te ngan song ba rnams la sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dag med na /
analyzed: gal te ngan song ba rnams la sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dag med na /
translated: If those in the lower realms do not have vows or negative commitments,

original: 'on mdo las gang gsungs pa zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on mdo las gang gsungs pa zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then what is the meaning of the sutra that says, ‚ÄúWhat is a vow?üîΩIt is the abandonment of all evil deeds,üîΩthe abandonment of all suffering,üîΩand the abandonment of all afflictions.üîΩIt is the abandonment of all suffering that is either temporary or permanent.

original: dus re zhig dang gtan du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba can gang zhig yin pa de ni dus re zhig sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir bde ba yin la /
analyzed: dus re zhig dang gtan du zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba can gang zhig yin pa de ni dus re zhig sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir bde ba yin la /
translated: That which has a pleasant result is happiness, because it protects from suffering for a while.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni gtan du sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir bde ba yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni gtan du sdug bsngal las yongs su skyob pa'i phyir bde ba yin te /
translated: That which is the attainment of nirvana is happiness, because it protects from suffering forever.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rtag tu sdug bsngal med do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rtag tu sdug bsngal med do //
translated: In complete nirvana, there is never any suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di la rnam par brtags pa dang rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsam gtan gsum po g-yo ba dang bcas par gsungs pa ma
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di la rnam par brtags pa dang rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsam gtan gsum po g-yo ba dang bcas par gsungs pa ma
translated: In this way, the Bhagavan said that the three meditative attainments are associated with movement.

original: yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la 'di la dga' ba dang ma bral ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bshad pa dang gsum pa la yang 'di la
analyzed: yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la 'di la dga' ba dang ma bral ba gang yin pa 'di ni 'dir 'phags pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bshad pa dang gsum pa la yang 'di la
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the statement, ‚ÄúThe non-separation from joy here is the movement of aryas.‚Äù

original: bde'o bde'o snyam du sems kyi gtong ba gang yin pa 'di ni der 'phags pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bshad pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: bde'o bde'o snyam du sems kyi gtong ba gang yin pa 'di ni der 'phags pa rnams kyi g-yo ba'o zhes gsungs so zhes bshad pa bsdu'o //
translated: And the statement, ‚ÄúThe mental release that thinks, ‚ÄòI am happy, I am happy‚Äô is the movement of aryas here.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir 'dir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las dge ba thams cad mi g-yo ba nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'dir gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las dge ba thams cad mi g-yo ba nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it that all virtuous karma of the form and formless realms is called ‚Äúnonmoving‚Äù?

original: mi g-yo ba dang mthun par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang mthun par 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The path that is compatible with the immovable is called the path that is compatible with the immovable.

original: mi g-yo ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gro ba'i lam las brtsams te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩyang ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi skyon dang bcas pa nyid kyi g-yo ba dang bcas pa kho na gzhan du mi g-yo bar gsungs she na /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba dang rjes su mthun par 'gro ba'i lam las brtsams te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi skyon dang bcas pa nyid kyi g-yo ba dang bcas pa kho na gzhan du mi g-yo bar gsungs she na /
translated: The meaning is that it is the path that is compatible with the immovable.

original: gang phyir sa ni de dag tu //
analyzed: gang phyir sa ni de dag tu //
translated: Why is it said that only the path that is compatible with the immovable is unshakable, but not the path that is compatible with the weak?

original: las rnams smin phyir mi g-yo'i phyir //
analyzed: las rnams smin phyir mi g-yo'i phyir //
translated: Because karma ripens in those stages,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩlongs spyod @43a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so // longs spyod @43a * //
translated: it is unshakable.üîΩBecause karma ripens in those stages, it is unshakable.üîΩThe enjoyment of wealth and so on

original: la sogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba longs spyod pa ni nor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba longs spyod pa ni nor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of wealth is the abundance of wealth.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs bzang ba dang skad snyan pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs bzang ba dang skad snyan pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes a good body, a pleasant voice, and so on.

original: de nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lha dag gi nang du rnam par smin par gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid res 'ga' rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni lha dag gi nang du rnam par smin par gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid res 'ga' rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis te /
translated: That very karma that ripens among the gods sometimes, due to the power of other conditions,

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshogs pa de'i dbang gis mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dag gi nang du rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan tshogs pa de'i dbang gis mi dang dud 'gro dang yi dags dag gi nang du rnam par smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Through the power of other conditions such as affliction, it ripens among humans, animals and ghosts.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is like the following example:üîΩThis person is a donor and a benefactor, but he is also a great killer.

original: 'di ni la la sbyin pa po yin zhing sbyin bdag yin la de yang shin tu srog gcod pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par de glang po cher gyur na glang po che'i rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs dag thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'iüîΩbar gsungs pa dang / yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni la la sbyin pa po yin zhing sbyin bdag yin la de yang shin tu srog gcod pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par de glang po cher gyur na glang po che'i rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs dag thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar gsungs pa dang / yang 'di lta ste /
translated: If he becomes an elephant, he obtains various ornaments of an elephant.

original: 'di ni la las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba chung du kun du brten zhing bsgom pa dang lan mang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni la las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba chung du kun du brten zhing bsgom pa dang lan mang du byas pa yin la /
translated: This person relies on a small basis of merit that arises from generosity, similarly, he relies on a small basis of merit that arises from ethics and from meditation, and he cultivates and increases it.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag lha bzang po rnams sam /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag lha bzang po rnams sam /
translated: He thinks, I will be born among the gods or humans.

original: mi bzang po rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur na ci ma rung snyam du sems na zhes bya ba nas de ni der skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs so //
analyzed: mi bzang po rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur na ci ma rung snyam du sems na zhes bya ba nas de ni der skye'o zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs so //
translated: If one thinks, How good it would be if I were reborn with the fortune equal to that of good people, up to he is reborn there.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan gsum mo zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dag na ni bde ba'i tshor ba lus kyi bde ba dang sems kyi yid bde ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan gsum mo zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dag na ni bde ba'i tshor ba lus kyi bde ba dang sems kyi yid bde ba yin no //
translated: The desire realm and the three absorptions. In the desire realm and the first absorption, the feeling of pleasure is physical pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni bde ba'i tshor ba yid bde ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni bde ba'i tshor ba yid bde ba yin no //
translated: In the second absorption, the feeling of pleasure is mental satisfaction.

original: gsum pa na ni sems kyi bde ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa na ni sems kyi bde ba yin no //
translated: In the third absorption, it is mental pleasure.

original: de yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says,

original: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sdug bsngal dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sdug bsngal dang sbyar te /
translated: that refers to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de 'dod pa'i khams kho nan yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di'i zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de 'dod pa'i khams kho nan yod pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di'i zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to show that that suffering exists only in the desire realm, it says here.

original: tshogs dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshogs par byed cing skyed par byed pas na tshogs de dbang po dang yul dang rten gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dis tshogs par byed cing skyed par byed pas na tshogs de dbang po dang yul dang rten gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúaccompanied by its collection‚Äù means that the collection is the cause that generates and produces that feeling. The collection is characterized by the sense faculties, objects, and the body.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu ni tshor ba tshogs pa dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩbsam gtan khyad par rnam smin las //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu ni tshor ba tshogs pa dang bcas pa yin no // bsam gtan khyad par rnam smin las //
translated: Therefore, the result of that action is feeling accompanied by its collection.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i tshor ba ni bsam @43b gtan khyad par can du skyes pa na tshor ba yod par bya dgos la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i tshor ba ni bsam @43b gtan khyad par can du skyes pa na tshor ba yod par bya dgos la /
translated: The feeling that is the result of the action that produces the special meditative state of the fourth meditative absorption is the feeling that is experienced in the special meditative state.

original: de na yang bde ba 'am sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med de /
analyzed: de na yang bde ba 'am sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med de /
translated: However, there is no experience of pleasure or pain in that meditative state.

original: de lta bas na 'di'i rnam par smin pa bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin pas bsam gtan bzhi pa man chad na yang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod do zhesüîΩbya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di'i rnam par smin pa bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yin pas bsam gtan bzhi pa man chad na yang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod do zhesüîΩbya bar mngon no //
translated: Therefore, the ripening of that action is a feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful. Thus, it is evident that there is action that produces a feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful in the fourth meditative absorption and below.

original: las gzhan gang gis kyang bsam gtan khyad par can du tshor ba rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhing mi srid de /
analyzed: las gzhan gang gis kyang bsam gtan khyad par can du tshor ba rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhing mi srid de /
translated: No other karma whatsoever ripens as feeling in the special meditative attainment of the base of infinite space.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can la yod pa de ni dngos gzhi bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba yin zhes brjod par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can la yod pa de ni dngos gzhi bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i las bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin par 'gyur ba yin zhes brjod par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that the feeling that exists in the special meditative attainment of the base of infinite space is the maturational result of karma of the first absorption level that is to be experienced as pleasure.

original: dngos gzhi ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bsam gtan khyad par can pas dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bsam gtan khyad par can pas dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the actual basis is inferior to the special meditative attainment since it possesses investigation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not karma to be experienced in the desire realm.

original: sa tha dad pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ de nyid kyi phyir dang de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa tha dad pa'i phyir ro ; / de nyid kyi phyir dang de las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yang ma yin no //
translated: Because the levels are different.

original: nyes pa 'di yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /
translated: It is also not the maturational result of the fourth absorption and so on, because it is inferior to that and because one is free from attachment to that level.

original: kha cig na re bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i dbang po kho na yin no zhes zer zhing smra'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i dbang po kho na yin no zhes zer zhing smra'o //
translated: Some say: The karmic maturation of karma of the special meditative stabilization is the faculty of pleasure of the absorptions alone.

original: gzhan dag na re de'i rnam par smin pa'i tshor ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de'i rnam par smin pa'i tshor ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Others say: It is the feeling of its karmic maturation that does not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gzugs la sogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gzugs la sogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: What is it? It is form and so on.

original: ci de dag gi ltar na bsam gtan khyad par can du skyes pa la tshor ba med dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de dag gi ltar na bsam gtan khyad par can du skyes pa la tshor ba med dam zhe na /
translated: According to them, do those born in the special meditative stabilization not have feeling?

original: yod mod kyi de rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod mod kyi de rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They do exist, but they are not by nature karmic maturation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They arise from natural outflow.

original: slob dpon gyis 'di ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'di ni bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Vasubandhu says: This contradicts the treatise.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i dbang po kho na yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa dang / de'i rnam par smin pa tshor ba med pa nyid do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin te de bstan pa'i phyir bstan bcos las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i dbang po kho na yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa dang / de'i rnam par smin pa tshor ba med pa nyid do zhes smras pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yin te de bstan pa'i phyir bstan bcos las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The assertion that the karmic maturation of the action of special absorption is the faculty of pleasure of the absorptions and the assertion that its karmic maturation is the absence of feeling both contradict the treatise.üîΩTo explain that, the text says:üîΩbecause it is stated in the treatise.

original: rtog pa med pa'i las zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i las zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can gyi las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnonconceptual action‚Äù means the action of special absorption.

original: @44a * // de'i phyir rtog pa med pa'i las dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems kyi tshor ba kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir las de'i rnam par smin pa ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i dbang po kho na yang ma yin
analyzed: @44a * // de'i phyir rtog pa med pa'i las dge ba'i rnam par smin pa ni sems kyi tshor ba kho na rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir las de'i rnam par smin pa ni bsam gtan gyi bde ba'i dbang po kho na yang ma yin
translated: Therefore, because it is stated in the treatise that the virtuous karmic maturation of nonconceptual action is the karmic maturation of mental feeling alone, the karmic maturation of that action is not the faculty of pleasure of the absorptions alone.

original: la tshor ba las gzhan yang ma yin no zhes bya bar mngon te /
analyzed: la tshor ba las gzhan yang ma yin no zhes bya bar mngon te /
translated: It is understood that it is not other than feeling.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i las ni bsam gtan khyad par can nas bzung ba yan chad na yod do //

translated: Therefore, karma to be experienced is so called because it is the cause of certain migration.üîΩKarma to be experienced in hell is so called because it is the cause of certain migration to the realm of hell.

analyzed: dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba na ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa yod pas 'gro ba nges pa'i rgyu de'i phyir de myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Karma to be experienced in other realms is so called because it is the cause of certain migration to other realms of the desire realm, such as the human realm.üîΩKarma to be experienced in other realms of the desire realm is called both white and black, since both virtue and nonvirtue exist there.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnyi ga yang bye brag ma phye bar bsres nas dkar nag ces bya bar bshad kyi 'di ltar dge ba yang dkar nag yin la de bzhin du mi dge ba yang dkar nag yin no zhes byaüîΩbar gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams myong bar 'gyur ba ni gnyi ga yang bye brag ma phye bar bsres nas dkar nag ces bya bar bshad kyi 'di ltar dge ba yang dkar nag yin la de bzhin du mi dge ba yang dkar nag yin no zhes bya bar gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not to be taken as meaning that virtue is white and black and that nonvirtue is white and black.

original: dge ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dge ba dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not mixed with virtue.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.

original: nyon mongs can min mthong spong min zhes bya bar nges pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dge ba ni med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong spong min zhes bya bar nges pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dge ba ni med do //
translated: This is because it is ascertained that it is not virtuous and not to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'dir rnam pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nag po yin no zhes khyad par byas nas brjod dgos so //

translated: Here, it is necessary to specify that the form realm is black and to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de lta ma yin na mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa yang gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa yin par bshad par thal bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /

translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the form realm and the formless realm to be abandoned by the path of seeing would also be explained as black and having black karmic maturation.
